occurrences.context: good, but we really would like for you to come. And I was like, listen, I'm not trying to be unkind, but I plan things in advance, so if you really want me to come, you better let me know the dates as soon as you know what they are. And not that I get asked to preach a lot, but I do have things on the calendar, but I don't put those things on the calendar without seeking the will of the Lord, number one, and I don't put them on the calendar presuming that I'm actually going to be here. I don't know, and you don't know. And these individual believers, this group that were making these plans, they are given this profitable counsel, and it is a reality that every one of us must acknowledge in our lives. Indeed, our life is brief. It's illustrated here as a vapor. We find that Psalm 102 and verse number 11 illustrates our lives as being a shadow, and we understand the brevity of life. How many times you live, I remember when I was a teenager, many of you can remember back to being a teenager in school, and you felt like time kind of just stood still, and you could not wait for the school year to get over. I wasn't one that really loved school a whole lot. I did
